meta.title: Resources for Municipal Battery Programs | Labrador Field Systems
meta.description: RFP templates, pilot playbooks, and program planning tools for cities moving off generators.

hero.title: Tools for Cities Moving Off Generators
hero.description: RFP language, pilot playbooks, buying checklists, and reporting templates designed for municipal procurement and grant compliance.

items.title: City Pilot Playbook
items.description: [RESOURCE: Comprehensive guide for 24-month pilots covering markets, parks, events, and field crews. Stakeholder alignment, budget sizing, phase timelines, success metrics, and policy pathways.]

items.title: Sample RFP Language
items.description: [RESOURCE: Performance-based specifications for portable battery services. Evaluation criteria beyond price: safety, reliability, reporting capabilities, municipal experience. Helps procurement staff write RFPs that select for outcomes, not just hardware.]

items.title: 24-Month Pilot Timeline
items.description: [RESOURCE: Template timeline showing Planning, Infrastructure, Deployment, and Optimization phases. Aligned with CPA grant structure. Includes key milestones, department coordination points, and decision gates.]

items.title: Field Crew Buying Checklist
items.description: [RESOURCE: For cities purchasing their own units. Chemistry selection, capacity sizing, charging infrastructure, safety certifications, warranty terms, and vendor support expectations. Helps Public Works departments specify city-owned hardware.]

items.title: Impact Reporting Template
items.description: [RESOURCE: Data collection and reporting formats for CPA grants and climate action plans. Tracks kWh delivered, generator-hours avoided, estimated emissions reductions, vendor participation, and community feedback. Export-ready for Council presentations.]

items.title: Program Economics Model
items.description: [RESOURCE: Spreadsheet comparing total cost of ownership for generators vs. managed battery fleets. Includes capex, fuel, maintenance, staff time, and shared fleet efficiency. Supports budget justification and business case development.]

items.title: FAQ for City Staff
items.description: [RESOURCE: Common questions about hybrid ownership models, emergency power scope, user training, safety and liability, vendor transition support, and scaling beyond pilots. Written for cross-department teams.]
